subject: Data
title: The Open Data Movement: Data Belongs to Everyone
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Open Data Movement: Data Belongs to Everyone.

hook.text: Governments collect data with your taxes. Shouldn't you be able to see it?

buildup.text: The open data movement argues that publicly funded data should be freely available to all citizens.

discovery.text: Open data means data that anyone can access, use, and share without restrictions or fees.

twist.text: Most government data remained locked in filing cabinets or incompatible databases until the 2000s.

climax.text: Today over 100 countries have open data portals, publishing everything from budgets to bus schedules.

punchline.text: Public data paid by the public should be available to the public.

quiz.question: What defines open data?
options: Data anyone can access, use, and share freely
